summary: This bill, the "Banning SPR Oil Exports to Foreign Adversaries Act," prohibits the U.S. Secretary of Energy from exporting or selling petroleum products drawn from the Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR) to specific countries (China, North Korea, Russia, and Iran) or entities controlled by them or the Chinese Communist Party. The Secretary can waive this prohibition if it is in the national security interest of the United States. The bill also mandates the Secretary to issue a rule to implement this prohibition within 60 days of enactment and makes related conforming and clerical amendments to existing laws.
